conbody.p:
A dataset is a flat composition of attributes (no association to other domain object). Based on one single class, a dataset can contain (by value) attributes of other classes; directly or indirectly associated to the based class. A dataset can be composed of the following types of elements:
Class attribute (see section ).
Calculated attribute (see section ).

Dataset is the only domain object that can be used for:
Designing modules and fragments.
Creating completion and validation rules.

To ease dataset creation and maintenance, a class can be copied into a dataset and marked as synchronized. If the class evolves, the same changes need to apply on the dataset. A strong link between the base-class and the dataset is then required. The dataset needs to be declared as Synchronized (see section ).
A dataset can be marked as the default linked dataset (see section ).
